hint.text:
Irreducible factors cannot be broken down further.
Eg: \(x(2x+4y)\) can still be further reduced to \(2x(x+2y).\)

solution.text:
\(_{{3*m}}_xyz = _{{3*m}}_x \times yz, _{{6*m}}_xy = _{{3*m}}_x \times {2y}, _{{9*m}}_xz = _{{3*m}}_x \times {3z} \), hence, _{{3*m}}_\(x\) is a common factor for all three terms.
Using distributive law,
\( _{{3*m}}_xyz + _{{6*m}}_xy + _{{9*m}}_xz= _{{3*m}}_x(yz+2y+3z)\)
